Experience

San Camp, a romantic & luxurious desert camp is set in a private concession on the border of the Makgadikgadi Pans of Botswana.
With only the desert & salt pans as a backdrop, San Camp provides an opportunity for guests to get away from it all & enjoy the solitude & tranquillity that can only be found in the desert.

Stay

A maximum of 14 guests is accommodated in 7 large, white canvas tents on slightly elevated wooden platforms, each equipped with an en-suite bathroom. The views from the tent’s viewing decks are truly magnificent.
The lodge’s main area consists of an open-plan comfortable lounge, dining room, bar & exercise pavilion.

Activities

San Camp offers open 4x4 safari drives in the Makgadikgadi National Park as well as exciting walks through the concession. A real highlight is spending time with the resident meerkats, something unique to this area.
Quad bike trips to the Ntwetwe Pan is a great way to explore the area & guests can also enjoy picnics, set up in beautiful desert locations. Horseback safaris are also offered, as well as trips to The Fallen Boabab – one of three of the largest & oldest trees in Africa.
During summer, the biggest drawing card is experiencing the awe-inspiring spectacle of Southern Africa’s last surviving zebra & wildebeest migration.

subfolders.title: Camp Kalahari
subfolders.description: Camp Kalahari is an authentic tented safari camp, located in the magnificent Makgadikgadi Pans area of Botswana. Camp Kalahari offers travellers a more affordable alternative to its luxurious sister camps:  Jack’s Camp & San Camp.  The best time to visit is during the wet season when guests will have a good opportunity to see the zebra & wildebeest migration as well as flamingos in their hundreds. The lodge consists of 12 comfortable Meru-styled tents – each equipped with an en-suite bathroom.  Two of these tents make up a family tent, comprising of 2 bedrooms & a joined bathroom.  Each tent is furnished with rich textiles, Moroccan kilims & four-poster beds.

subfolders.title: Jack's Camp
subfolders.description: Jack’s Camp, an authentic & luxurious camp is set in a private concession on the border of the Makgadikgadi Pans of Botswana. Surrounded by desert & salt pans, Jack’s Camp provides a unique safari experience that cannot be found anywhere else in the country.  It is the only camp in Africa with a swimming pool tent, & one of a few that offers exciting Meerkat encounters. Accommodation is in 10 beautiful canvas tents, decorated in a classic 1940’s safari style.  Each tent is equipped with an en-suite bathroom boasting an indoor & outdoor shower.  The tent decks offer spectacular views over the desert, along with gorgeous sunrises & sunsets.

subfolders.title: Leroo La Tau
subfolders.description: Leroo La Tau is situated in the Makgadikgadi Pans National Park.  Raised majestically above the Boteti River, guests have an opportunity to view the bush from an elevated platform, allowing for unobstructed views of Africa’s wildlife. The park, populated by up to 30,000 zebra and wildebeest closely accompanied by predators, offers guests the chance to experience the exhilaration of seeing large concentrations of game & the resultant predator interaction. Leroo La Tau offers 12 thatched chalets overlooking the Makgadikgadi Pans National Park, each with beautiful en-suite bathrooms.  The main lodge offers a dining room, reading room & bar as well as expansive wooden decks & plunge pool – perfect for cooling off after a day out.

subfolders.title: Meno A Kwena
subfolders.description: Meno a Kwena boasts a spectacular location on the Boteti River overlooking the Makgadikgadi Pans National Park – a completely contrasting location to the green & lush Okavango Delta region. The zebra migration is resident here for much of the year, & in the dry season there is no other water around, so the Boteti River becomes the magnet for wildlife. There are 8 double safari tents at Meno a Kwena, 6 of which are twin tents & 2 are king tents.  Each twin tent is equipped with an indoor & outdoor shower, whereas the king tents all have outdoor showers.

subfolders.title: Nxai Pan Camp
subfolders.description: Nxai Pan Camp is located in the wildlife-rich Nxai Pan National Park, a unique reserve encompassing a fossilized lakebed & the famous Baines’ Baobabs. Here, in the remote corners of Botswana, a unique mix of savannah & Kalahari species can be found.  The biggest draw to the park is during summer when zebras migrate by the thousands to the area to drop their young – the second-largest land animal migration in Southern Africa. The camp is located on the western edge of the fossil pan from which the camp takes its name.
